summary: Fix hero section layout shifts during typing animation by implementing consistent height constraints and preventing text wrapping issues across all screen sizes

action_plan.description: Calculate optimal fixed heights for typing text container by measuring the longest phrase ('Machine Learning Researcher') across all responsive breakpoints and font sizes
Update desktop hero-title CSS to use calculated fixed height instead of min-height, ensuring it accommodates the longest phrase without wrapping
Update mobile hero-title CSS (max-width: 768px) to use appropriate fixed height for smaller font sizes and screen widths
Add CSS properties to prevent text wrapping and ensure consistent line height behavior (white-space: nowrap, overflow: hidden if needed)
Test the typing animation across different screen sizes to verify no layout shifts occur during phrase transitions
Optimize CSS performance by adding contain: layout to typing text elements to isolate layout calculations

risks: Fixed height might create excessive white space on very small screens if not calculated properly
Text might get cut off on edge cases with very small viewport widths
Changes could affect other hero section elements' positioning
Font loading delays could temporarily show incorrect heights before web fonts load
dependencies: Need to test across multiple screen sizes (mobile, tablet, desktop)
Requires browser testing to measure actual rendered text dimensions
Should verify with different font loading scenarios
May need to coordinate with any future changes to typing animation phrases
issue_title: Bug: Hero section moves up and down when typing animation changes text length
